intro: Restio rhodocoma, commonly known as the red-stemmed restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in coastal and sandy environments, often growing in open, sunny habitats. Restio rhodocoma is typically found in coastal dunes and is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds.
